decks.notes: The deck revolves around quickly ramping up energy through cards like Servant of the Conduit and Attune with Aether to play Aetherworks Marvel. By using Aetherworks Marvel to spin the wheel and potentially cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats. The inclusion of cards like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Kozilek's Return provides additional utility and control options to deal with opposing strategies. The key to success lies in efficiently generating energy and utilizing Aetherworks Marvel to cheat out game-ending threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Smuggler's Copter and Bloodhall Priest, along with removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Lightning Axe, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of Key to the City allows for additional card draw and evasion for key creatures. Overall, this deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle to secure victories.

The main focus of this Azorius Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with aggressive creatures like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, Reflector Mage, and Archangel Avacyn. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Selfless Spirit and Spell Queller to control the opponent's plays. With cards like Smuggler's Copter and Key to the City, the deck aims to keep up the pressure and maintain card advantage. Stasis Snare provides removal, while Port Town and Prairie Stream ensure mana consistency. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Aetherworks Marvel combo by using cards like Attune with Aether and Servant of the Conduit to generate energy. Once Aetherworks Marvel is on the battlefield, players can activate it to potentially cheat powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger into play. Additionally, the deck includes ways to control the board with cards like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Chandra, Torch of Defiance, while also providing energy to fuel the combo with cards like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot and Harnessed Lightning.

The main concept of this Azorius Aggro deck is to establish early board presence with low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Selfless Spirit, backed up by disruptive spells such as Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn provide additional threats and resilience. The deck aims to control the battlefield with cards like Stasis Snare while maintaining a tempo advantage with Smuggler's Copter. Thalia, Heretic Cathar disrupts opponent's mana base, and Declaration in Stone handles opposing threats. Revolutionary Rebuff and Spell Shrivel offer some counterplay to spells.

The deck revolves around ramping up energy counters quickly to play powerful game-winning spells, such as Emrakul, the Promised End, using Aetherworks Marvel to cheat them onto the battlefield. It also includes powerful removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Harnessed Lightning to control the board and protect your combo pieces. The deck also includes some card draw and mana fixing to ensure a smooth gameplay experience while trying to assemble the combo.

The deck focuses on using Aetherworks Marvel to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul, while also gaining energy through cards like Servant of the Conduit and Woodweaver's Puzzleknot. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional energy generation and removal, Ishkanah helps with defense, and Linvala provides lifegain. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm opponents with massive creatures, while also having some control elements with cards like Harnessed Lightning. The key strategy is to efficiently use energy resources to cast game-changing threats.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively attack the opponent's life total using a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource, with cards like Cryptbreaker and Haunted Dead, to maximize the value of cards like Prized Amalgam and Voldaren Pariah. The deck also includes card draw and discard outlets like Cathartic Reunion to maintain a steady stream of threats and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, relentless assault while utilizing graveyard synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures in combination with disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. By curbing their opponent's options with cards like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage, they can clear the way for their creatures to deal significant damage. Cards like Selfless Spirit and Archangel Avacyn provide protection for their board while also providing additional threats. The inclusion of vehicles like Smuggler's Copter and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship allows for additional aggression and evasion. Ultimately, the goal is to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the battlefield.

This deck is focused on utilizing aggressive creatures in the Azorius colors to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy involves playing efficient threats such as Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Spell Queller, backed up by disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Stasis Snare. The deck also includes cards like Selfless Spirit and Archangel Avacyn to protect its creatures and maintain board presence. With a mix of aggression, disruption, and protection, this Azorius Aggro deck aims to swiftly deal damage and control the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures and disruptive spells in order to control the board. This Azorius Aggro deck utilizes cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Smuggler's Copter to put pressure on the opponent, while cards like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller help to control the opponent's board. By being proactive and controlling the game's tempo, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The focus of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, supported by disruptive spells such as Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. The inclusion of Smuggler's Copter allows for additional card advantage and evasion, while Stasis Snare provides removal options. The mana base is constructed to allow for consistent access to both white and blue mana sources, ensuring the deck can quickly apply pressure and control the battlefield.

This deck focuses on using removal spells and graveyard recursion to control the game and out-value the opponent. By utilizing cards like Liliana, the Last Hope and Ishkanah, Grafwidow, the deck can generate card advantage and maintain board control. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Promised End as a late game threat adds another dimension to the deck's control strategy. The deck also has a strong mana base with cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Evolving Wilds to ensure consistent access to its powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building toward a powerful late-game win condition. It includes powerful removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Ruinous Path to deal with threats, along with cards like Liliana, the Last Hope and Ishkanah, Grafwidow to generate value and control the board. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with card advantage and efficient removal, eventually closing out the game with threats like Emrakul, the Promised End or Noxious Gearhulk.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up energy counters to activate Aetherworks Marvel and cheat Emrakul, the Promised End into play. Utilizing cards like Attune with Aether, Servant of the Conduit, and Woodweaver's Puzzleknot to generate energy and mana, the goal is to get Emrakul out as early as possible to overwhelm the opponent. Ishkanah, Grafwidow provides defense and a back-up win condition, while Chandra, Torch of Defiance offers additional removal and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main idea of this deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and pump them up with anthem effects like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching. By putting constant pressure on the opponent and quickly building a strong board presence, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Powerful aggressive creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger and Thraben Inspector provide both consistent damage and card advantage, while support cards like Declaration in Stone help to clear any potential blockers in the way. Additionally, the inclusion of Smuggler's Copter provides extra evasion and card filtering for the deck.
